newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Plains feedlot cattle light at $66 - feedlots.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Plains feedlot cattle light at $66 - feedlots.

text.p: U.S. Plains feedlot cattle Thursday sold at $66.00 per cwt in light volume, unchanged from the bulk of this week's sales and $1.00 higher than last week, feedlot sources said.
About 1,600 head sold in Kansas and no sales were reported for the Texas Panhandle and western Oklahoma area, they said.
Most of this week's showlist was sold. There were about 78,000 head sold in the Panhandle and 103,100 in Kansas, according to USDA.
Extreme cold the past week slowed weight gains at most feedlots as cattle struggled to stay warm, sources said.
Temperatures were expected to warm this weekend, with readings early next week projected at 50 degrees Fahrenheit in Kansas and the Panhandle, feedlot sources said.
Warmer temperatures could give cattle a chance to put on some weight. Many already were running light from feedlots being extremely current and from the recent cold, they said.
The lighter weight cattle should result in smaller beef production, compared with a year ago, which could continue to underpin fed cattle prices, market sources said.
